verses.verse: But judgment will return to righteousness, And all the upright in heart will follow it.
Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? Who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?
Unless the LORD had been my help, My soul would soon have settled in silence.
If I say, “My foot slips,” Your mercy, O LORD, will hold me up.
In the multitude of my anxieties within me, Your comforts delight my soul.
Shall (Amos 6:3) the throne of iniquity, which devises evil by law, Have fellowship with You?
They gather together against the life of the righteous, And condemn ((Ex. 23:7); Ps. 106:38; (Prov. 17:15); Matt. 27:4) innocent blood.
But the LORD has been my defense, And my God the rock of my refuge.
He has brought on them their own iniquity, And shall cut them off in their own wickedness; The LORD our God shall cut them off.
A Call to Worship and Obedience Oh come, let us sing to the LORD! Let us shout joyfully to the Rock of our salvation.
Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving; Let us shout joyfully to Him with (Eph. 5:19; James 5:13) psalms.
